thread.title: Carmike Cinemas Falls After Debt Refinancing Leads to Loss
thread.title_full: Carmike Cinemas Falls After Debt Refinancing Leads to Loss - Bloomberg Business

author: Rob Golum
title: Carmike Cinemas Falls After Debt Refinancing Leads to Loss
text:
Carmike Cinemas Inc., one of the largest U.S. theater chains, fell almost 10 percent in extended trading after reporting a second-quarter loss, the result of refinancing costs.
The shares fell as much as 9.9 percent to $23.46 in late trading following the exhibitor’s earnings release Monday. The stock was little changed at $26.04 at the close in New York.
The company recorded refinancing costs of $17.6 million, Chief Financial Officer Richard B. Hare said Monday in a statement. Excluding those costs and some other items, Carmike reported earnings of 36 cents a share. Analysts were projecting 54 cents.
Revenue rose 20 percent to $219.1 million, a reflection of higher admission prices, more screens and a strong slate of pictures from Hollywood. That missed the $219.9 million average of seven analysts’ estimates.
Columbus, Georgia-based Carmike reported a second-quarter net loss of $1.45 million, or 6 cents a share.
(Carmike plans a conference call at 5 p.m. New York time. Listen at www.carmikeinvestors.com)
